name: BRIDGE-Editor - Previewing Workflow
description:
As a Study Builder user
I want to publish my enhanced trial
so that patients can see the enhanced information

steps.name: I am a Bridge user
I make some changes to a trial
I preview my changes
I publish the changes
I should be able to see those changes publicly available

As a Product Owner
I want to display a welcome page 
so that we inform clients of the process

steps.name: I am a Bridge user
I login into Bridge
I should see the Bridge welcome message
I am a Bridge user
I login into Bridge
I should see the Bridge welcome message
I should be able to read the Bridge Terms of Use

name: Trial search
description:
As a potential trial participant
I want to be asked questions and shown results based on what type of diabetes trials I have said I am interested in
So that the results are meaningful and useful to me

The scenario's expectations are based on the results given by the search_trials tool
(see https://github.com/trialreach/augmented-triality/tree/master/scripts/search_trials).
The tool does NOT consider the complete annotation process so the provided list of trials has to be manually filtered
based on this list: https://github.com/trialreach/annotation-tool/blob/master/metadata/diagnostic-areas.csv

Expectations are expressed using real data. This because at the moment QBMS is not configured to consume different
data at startup time. The downside of this approach is that these tests may fails with a release of QBMS that include
new data (trials annotations or trial sites locations).
Once QBMS will be able to consume fake trials location and annotations, it's strongly recommended to move to write
expectation against fixtures.

The search_trials tools requires the coordinates of the point to search from. Geolocation lookup has been done using
the same service used by MT (i.e. Google AutocompleteService). The quickest way to lookup a location coordinates is
to type a location in MT and inspect the requests to QBMS RankMatches endpoint to spot the coordinates associated
with the provided location.

elements.name: Search diabetes trial given one patient condition

steps.name: I am on the search page
I select Gestational diabetes [Other types of diabetes]

I provide a distance of 100 miles
I get redirected to the results page
I should see a trials list

elements.name: Search diabetes trial given multiple patient conditions

steps.name: I am on the search page
I select Type 1 diabetes, Diabetic foot ulcer [Diabetic complications]
I use the following answers to reach the results

cells: Where are you looking for trials?

steps.name: I decide to view the results
I should see a trials list
the trials should involve at least one of: Type 1 diabetes, Diabetic foot ulcer [Diabetic complications]

cells: Type 1 diabetes, Diabetic foot ulcer [Diabetic complications]

name: Distance filter
description:
As a potential trial participant
I want to specify how far I am willing to travel to participate in a clinical trial
So that I see trials in my results that are logistically reasonable for me.

elements.name: Decide initial distance during QA flow

steps.name: I am on the search page
I provide the conditions I'm interested into
I provide my location
I provide a distance of 10 miles
I answer questions until I can view the results
I decide to view the results
I should see a trials list
I should see trials within 10 miles

elements.name: Change distance filter when looking at search results

steps.name: I am on the search page
I use the following answers to reach the results
I decide to view the results
I change the distance to 20 miles

    at isVisible(".qa-resultsList") - waitForVisible.js:37:21

steps.name: I should see trials within 20 miles

name: MATCH - flow tracking
description:
As a product manager
I want to track users' journeys
So that I can check for any issues and make assessments of where the biggest impact optimisations can be made

steps.name: I am a product manager
I have a user that performs a search

cells: Type 1 diabetes, Diabetic foot ulcer [Diabetic complications]
Where are you looking for trials?

steps.name: I verify the tracked events
I should be able to reconstruct the user answers

cells: patient:A04 / weight / How much do you weigh?
